H0.text: There are two forms of classical Japanese theatre, 'Noh' is mostly spoken, but what name is given to the singing and dancing form. Bunraku

H1.text: There are two forms of classical Japanese theatre, 'Noh' is mostly spoken, but what name is given to the singing and dancing form. Kabuki-odori

H2.text: There are two forms of classical Japanese theatre, 'Noh' is mostly spoken, but what name is given to the singing and dancing form. Gagaku

H3.text: There are two forms of classical Japanese theatre, 'Noh' is mostly spoken, but what name is given to the singing and dancing form. 歌舞伎

A4.text: Kabuki (歌舞伎; Japanese pronunciation: [ka.bɯ.kʲi]) is a classical form of Japanese theatre, mixing dramatic performance with traditional dance.

A5.text: Bunraku, a traditional Japanese puppet theatre from whose scripts many kabuki plays were adapted.
